titlestmt.titleproper: Gardner, Gaylord and Cooper Family Records
titlestmt.author: SUNY Oswego

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Oswego

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Kathryn Johns-Masten
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Gardner, Gaylord and Cooper Family Records
did.abstract: The family records contain a genealogy of the Cooper family from 1845 to 1956. It also contains the legal papers of the Gaylord family, including deeds, mortgages and business correspondence.

repository.corpname: State University of New York at Oswego

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

bioghist.p: The Gardner, Gaylord and Cooper families have been historically prominent to central New York and Oswego County during days of the colonial pioneers.

scopecontent.p: Collection includes a thin bound book, handwritten genealogy notes, typed correspondences, legal papers, deed, bond, mortgages, tax search, interest records, checks, and abstracts of title.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.

scopecontent.p: Gardner Family Genealogy. Thin bound book. Patrilineage genealogy. A coat of arms is on inside cover.
Five-page handwritten genealogy of F.V. Cooper, Hudsons and Hanlons. Typed correspondence to Lima from Cleveland, Ohio. May 11, 1915.

Gaylord legal papers. Deed bond four mortgages two abstracts of title tax search interest records two interest checks correspondence of administration incomplete correspondence to Harry, September 10, 1918.
